Write-Up Text: People on social media are talking about the upcoming Australian federal budget specifically about the contentious Gillard-era parenting policy which may finally be on the way out. There's a proposal to allow single parents to continue staying at home for four more years without being shifted to JobSeeker. However some argue that the proposed changes are not enough and are only cosmetic designed to make the legislation more favorable. Other tweets call for the taxation of oil and energy giants to raise funds for job seekers arguing that this has been done successfully in countries like Norway and Finland. The post also makes references to the changing political landscape and the importance of playing to win.
